Message.Title: The DOW filling the "gap."
Message.Msg: I would consider the sudden "surge" after the FOMC announcement two days ago a "gap" because many got caught by the sudden move. The interesting thing is that the DOW not only didn't have any follow through to the upside yesterday but went below the lows after the surge the previous day. If shorts can stay put for a few days, all the "gains" in the DOW since 2 p.m. two days ago could evaporate.

Topic.Title: The scam is over...

Message.Msg: I am not saying that good investments will not also be hit. I am saying that there are plenty of companies whose fundamentals should justify a higher valuation than today. INTC is trading at EV of 6X EBITDA with a ~4% dividend yield. It has a record 240MM shares short at that massive misvaluation with respect to the marketplace. Even if/as the architecture is losing ground, it is still a full generation ahead of everyone else (which in the manufacturing economics of photolithography means it needs half the area to make the same chip and thus has high margins on EVERYTHING it manufactures, even ARM architectures). If the USD weakens LT as it loses sole global reserve, INTC is better positioned than anyone from its domestic manufacturing intensity. I deal in facts. Eventually, they always matter.

I don't disagree with you to say that INTC type stuff is in the same boat of chased high flier, but we are, afterall, in a hugely levered up market condtion which the Fed is gonna try to maintain in some of the reading I stated before: record margin interest and record market captialization to GDP measures. Topic.Title: The scam is over...

Message.Msg: It's going down and hard. Amazon cannot hide the working capital ponzi much longer. You know what happens in a deleveraging cycle? People use all those gift card and conserve discretionary cash. They use more intensely all you can eat plans without spending additional money that was assumed when pricing the plans. So, Amazon will see non-cash generating sales and lower content sales (higher reliance on "free" components of Prime. Then there the issue of utilization of fixed insfrastructure (whose costs are not variable and do not go away as demand weakens). Amazon has set itself up for a world of hurt. And it is all foreseeable...

Topic.Title: The scam is over...

Message.Msg: Dealing in facts is important. One fact is that the valuation of AMZN has no relation to being a moneymaking enterprise. If they don't earn anything, they will eventually need to borrow more money, unless they want to sell more shares, which is dilutive. The disconnect to price here is obvious to all, so in this case THAT is the fact. The way this ends will be interesting, but no fortunetellers have shown up yet. Remember always that Bezos was an Algo/derivatives guy, wedded to manipulation. The markets are sour from imbalances, but I see no Lone Ranger out there.

Message.Title: Baby I'm Amazed -- what shall we do?
Message.Msg: I never could have imagined that a slowing-growth, dwindling-profit, low-margin retailer with a forward PE over 100 and a PEG over 10 could put together a run like this. It would be interesting to know what's really causing this. In any case, I still think we'll see a price well below 300 before October 18 options expiration. If you look at the S&P, it's pretty much right where it was before the Fed's "shocking" announcement not to taper. So it appears that the shock value was temporary. And AMZN has no news or prospects to justify this runup; therefore the near-term direction seems to be down. The technicals seem to point to a pullback too (right at upper Bollinger Band and close to zero on Williams %R). Should we buy puts or just sell OTM call credit spreads?

Topic.Title: Baby I'm Amazed -- what shall we do?

Message.Msg: Oh, and this is the first above average volume day for a couple weeks, so it could be considered something of a blow-off top . . . maybe shorts finally capitulating?

But, the fundamentals have continuously degraded along the way and they are doing so because of the underlying fundamental economics. The trend south will continue and no upgrades nor secondary offering will hide it going forward.

Message.Msg: I don't expect others to necessarily agree. I think all public markets are now a scam because very little of it is "investing" even though it is couched as such. It is glorified skimming. WS institutions skim assets from John Q. Public and his/her 401K and pension funds. But, within the broader scam, Amazon epitomizes what is wrong with "investing" in the markets today. It has only to do with institutional control of float and quant/algo option scalping. Nothing more. BTW, AAPL and INTC were by far at the top of the buying on weakness list today.

Message.Msg: If the crackheads had the right info, they would have made a killing. There were several new etf's established today, that follow cloud computing. AMZN and FB (not sure why FB) where some of the stocks that went into these etf's. These etf's had an agreement to buy a huge sum of these stocks at todays closing price. The MM's moved the price higher over this week to make a killing on this deal, since they are the ones that provide these shares for these etf's. AMZN is going to get smoked next week.

Topic.Title: Tech, todays action sayz the pigz are going higher - not lower

Message.Msg: Watch the cash position going into Q4. As Amazon sells more low margin proprietary product, the cash flow ponzi gets perilous. It has to build inventory into the holiday season. Where other people (manufacturers, 3rd party) take the risk on non-Amazon product, Amazon now has loads of inventory build for Kindle, Fire, HD and whatever other #$%$ it will roll out. Compare the net working capital heading into Q3 over the past few years... 2013 2012 2011 2010 Cash 3704 2335 2047 1629 MS 3759 2635 4308 3479 Inv 5420 4380 3229 1940 AR 2861 2035 1438 805 DTA 541 408 257 265 CA 16285 11793 11279 8118 AP 8990 7072 5721 3545 AE 5745 3892 2324 1705 CL 14735 10964 8045 5250 NWC 1550 829 3234 2868 Net working capital has been dropping precipitously heading into the holiday as Amazon has "built out" its line of loss leading proprietary electronics. It has to bear the float on those (doesn't get the benefit of the negative working capital model that the analysts love and seem to have ignored here...). Had Amazon not raised $3B in LT debt, of which only $1.5B was used for the HQ, its NWC would be at ZERO heading into the holiday build. It's going to get REAL interesting...

Topic.Title: Tech, todays action sayz the pigz are going higher - not lower

Message.Msg: These are all end of Q2 balance sheets for the past 4 years. Notice how rapidly it started to fall when Amazon "refreshed" its Kindle product line and went balls out on being a proprietary hardware company. I'm sure it will end well...

Topic.Title: The scam is over...

Message.Msg: Buy, are you talking to me? I don't remotely think this is heading higher into December. No one "knows" where things are going, but it helps to actually be grounded in facts. See my recent post about net working capital heading into the holiday build. Amazon's has been rapidly declining YOY as its proprietary product inventory build has stressed the model. Even if everything goes perfectly, it will be hard for Amazon to avoid raising new debt or equity. Most likely, the crooks that will be underwriting it are doing the same thing now as last time. But, going back to the markets for more debt or new equity just 1 year later is going to #$%$ any real investor.
